introduction: Rosie's Diner has been the heart of Millbrook, a small farming town, for over thirty years. Every morning, the same regulars gather for coffee and gossip before starting their day. But this foggy Tuesday morning, when waitress Betty Lou arrives to open up at 5 AM, she discovers the diner's beloved owner, Rosie Martinez, lying motionless behind the counter. The front door was locked, but someone with a key gained entry during the night. In a town where everyone knows everyone else's business, secrets run deep beneath the surface of small-town friendliness. With only a handful of people who had access to the diner, you must uncover which trusted member of this tight-knit community betrayed Rosie's faith.
location: Behind the counter at Rosie's Diner
motive: Frank owes massive gambling debts to dangerous people. Rosie discovered he'd been skimming money from the town's charity fund that she helped manage and threatened to expose him.

characters.name: Frank Thompson
characters.personality: Friendly local handyman who seems genuinely upset by Rosie's death, but is hiding his financial desperation
knowledge: Rosie always arrived at the diner by 4:30 AM to prep for the morning rush
The back door lock has been sticking lately and needs jiggling
Rosie kept the week's earnings in an old coffee tin behind the register
She had been acting worried about something lately
secrets: He owes $50,000 to loan sharks who threatened his family
He's been taking small amounts from the town charity fund for months
Rosie confronted him yesterday about the missing money

characters.name: Betty Lou Williams
characters.personality: Sweet, elderly waitress who's worked at the diner for 15 years and treated Rosie like family
knowledge: Rosie had been staying late recently, going over the books
Someone has been calling the diner late at night and hanging up
Rosie mentioned being worried about the town charity fund
The kitchen window latch is broken and can be opened from outside
secrets: She saw Frank's truck parked behind the diner very early this morning
Rosie asked her yesterday who else had keys to the diner

characters.name: Deputy Tom Bradley
characters.personality: Young, earnest small-town cop who's responding to his first murder case and is overwhelmed
knowledge: There have been reports of suspicious activity around town lately
Rosie called the station two days ago asking about filing a report but never followed up
The diner's cash register appears untouched
No signs of forced entry at any of the doors
secrets: Frank has been asking a lot of questions about statute of limitations on embezzlement
Rosie seemed nervous when she called about filing that report

characters.name: Pastor David Chen
characters.personality: Compassionate local minister who knew everyone's struggles and is heartbroken by the tragedy
knowledge: Rosie was very active in church charity work and managed several community funds
Frank has been under financial stress and asked for prayer
Rosie had been counting and recounting charity donations recently
She mentioned being disappointed in someone she trusted
secrets: Frank confessed to him about gambling problems but made him promise not to tell anyone
Rosie asked him yesterday about forgiveness for people who steal from charity

characters.name: Martha Pike
characters.personality: Nosy town gossip who knows everyone's business and loves to share what she's observed
knowledge: Frank's been working odd hours lately, coming and going at strange times
Rosie had a heated phone conversation with someone yesterday afternoon
The charity fund was supposed to be announced at this Sunday's church service
Frank asked her last week about pawn shops in the next town over
secrets: She saw Frank arguing with some tough-looking strangers outside the bar last week
Rosie seemed scared when she mentioned Frank's name yesterday
